name: OGC Building Blocks tutorial examples repository
abstract: A set of building blocks introducing capabilities, as a sequence of exercises.
description: Follow the instructions in the "About section" of each building block, starting with the [Orientation](bblock/ogc.bbr.tutorial.exercise0) exercise.

bblocks.name: 00 - Orientation
bblocks.abstract: Orientation on the structure of Building Blocks

bblocks.name: 01 - JSON schema
bblocks.abstract: Provide and validate an example JSON file.  Shows how the examples management component works and introduces a basic JSON schema.  (Note that building blocks may documented other forms of specification, however JSON schemas support semantic interoperability using available standard approaches and OpenAPI applications, and will be featured in these tutorials.)

bblocks.name: 09 - RDF BB (completed)
bblocks.abstract: A building block defining a building block for a data model described in ontology standards OWL and SHACL.  Such a building block allows logical constraints to be inherited by multiple implementation schemas using semantic annotations (such as JSON-LD)

bblocks.name: 01 - JSON schema (completed)
bblocks.abstract: Shows what Exercise 1 looks like when finished

bblocks.name: 02 - JSON-LD
bblocks.abstract: Semantically annotate a schema by adding a simple JSON-LD context

bblocks.name: 02 - JSON-LD (completed)
bblocks.abstract: Semantically annotate a schema by adding a simple JSON-LD context

bblocks.name: 03 - Add Semantic Rules
bblocks.abstract: Add logical rules using SHACL to exploit semantic annotations

bblocks.name: 03 - Rules (completed)
bblocks.abstract: Add logical rules using SHACL to exploit semantic annotations

bblocks.name: 04 - Profile a BB (using rules)
bblocks.abstract: Profile another Building Block with additional constraint rules, include unit testing of these rules with pass and fail cases.

bblocks.name: 06 - Import/Extend
bblocks.abstract: Profiling a BBlock from another register

transforms.description: Adds a "PREF" prefix to all object keys.
transforms.code: walk(if type == "object" then with_entries( .key |= "PREF\(.)" ) else . end)

transforms.description: Changes the "http://example.com/" prefix of every predicate to a URN
A transform's code can also be defined inside the transform's object

bblocks.name: 08 - Advanced Transform Example
bblocks.abstract: This example highlights an advanced transform from CityJSON to TopoFeature, showing a range of features interacting to support this complex task.

transforms.description: Transforms CityJSON geometries and vertices to GeoJSON / TopoFeature features.

bblocks.name: 09 - RDF BB
bblocks.abstract: A building block defining a building block for a data model described in ontology standards OWL and SHACL.  Such a building block allows logical constraints to be inherited by multiple implementation schemas using semantic annotations (such as JSON-LD)

bblocks.name: 10 - Profiling an Ontology
bblocks.abstract: Often data models and schemas are re-used with specific constraints - i.e. as a profile. This example shows how using building blocks allows inheritance of rules from a base ontology and addition of such constraints using SHACL.

bblocks.name: 04 - Profiling (completed)
bblocks.abstract: Profile another Building Block with additional constraint rules, include unit testing of these rules with pass and fail cases.

bblocks.name: 05 - Features
bblocks.abstract: This example shows a simple customisation for OGC API Feature schemas

sources.title: OGC API - Features, Part 1, 7.16.2: Feature Response

bblocks.name: 05 - Features (completed)
bblocks.abstract: This example shows a simple customisation for OGC API Feature schemas

sources.title: OGC API - Features, Part 1, 7.16.2: Feature Response

bblocks.name: 06 - Import/Extend (completed)
bblocks.abstract: Profiling a BBlock from another register
